programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess works an extra shift at the 13th District and gets caught in the middle of a drive-by attack on refugees; the team works together to track down the shooter and uncover the true motive behind the attack.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater turns to an unlikely source of support when a string of jewelry store robberies shakes his confidence.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight believes the man who tried to kill him is someone he and Olinsky once put away; Atwater unintentionally spills information about Ruzek's history that disturbs Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence searches for a missing teen who they believe poses a threat to students at his school; Atwater wants to make a good impression on a police captain.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A Detective from Atlanta pays Nick and Sylvie to help in search of the local coroner's brother, who is in possession of the heart of a dead crime lord. The heart contains the evidence that there was fowl play in his death, and now the police and the real killer have descended on Key Mariah to find him, and more importantly the heart.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: After Sylvie shoots and kills a perp, her world shatters when she is told that the dead man was an undercover cop and she ends up in jail. Nick refuses to believe that the shooting was unjustified and investigates the cop's background.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old contact of Nick brings one of the DEA's top ten deadly assassins to the Key Mariah who is looking to settle an old score.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: While in the company of friends, Spider tells a tale of one of Nick and Sylvie's cases the way he remembers it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A gang tricks Nick into helping them commit a robbery. He gets arrested immediately. While Sylvie and Spider ask around outside, he looks for members of the gang among the other prisoners.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil creates a catapult out of popsicle sticks to demonstrate elastic energy, then makes a larger one that can launch pumpkins.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Friction is everywhere; Phil can't be blamed for trying to reduce it as much as he can; He builds a leaf-blower powered hover disc that he can ride; He also tries to increase his friction enough so he can climb straight up the walls.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The bald eagle can travel up to100 miles per hour during an aerial attack on unsespecting prey. Jellyfish are equipped with the deadliest venom on earth. Plus, a camels mouth is built to eat almost anything!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Visit NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and learn how a fleet of satellites is monitoring our planet. Philippe flies in a DC3 aircraft over Arizona as part of NASA's efforts to take soil moisture readings. Also, interviews with numerous Astronauts!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau explores the wild frontier of Alaska. He takes a trip deep into bear country and witnesses a brown bear hunting for salmon. We fly through the Denali National Park and land on a glacier near the tallest mountain in North America.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarret and Catherine meet a boy whose father is missing and could be in grave danger.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a professor is murdered, his boss, his teaching assistant and a student all come under suspicion.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Chin is kidnapped and left in Halawa prison dressed as an inmate, he must escape before the other prisoners recognize him.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The night before an election, the governor asks the team to investigate when a prostitute is found dead in a missing congressman's bed; Danny waits for a custody decision.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A double amputee (Peter Weller) goes after the police officers responsible for his injuries -- including McGarrett.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the murder of a Lua master; McGarrett has a private investigator tail his mother.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny obsesses about the big game during all-pro weekend in Hawaii; a star football player helps the team investigate the murder of a tech executive.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a murder victim lands in Dog the Bounty Hunter's vehicle, Catherine goes under cover and investigates at a local roller derby.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team struggles to narrow down a suspect when threats against a company that endangers sharks turn deadly; Kamekona tries to earn his helicopter license.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum is tasked with finding a single mom being hunted by two very dangerous gangs; while Higgins is abroad with Ethan, a misstep forces her to assist an old employer.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: While Magnum and Higgins reunite and work the case of a construction worker's tragic death, TC and Shammy get skyjacked by a pair of drug runners posing as tourists.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum, Higgins and Rick go under cover at a ritzy country club when a young caddie is fired after being accused of stealing a member's golf clubs; Jin's niece, unaware of her uncle's shady past, asks him to speak at her school.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Higgins' therapist hires her to look into why one of her teenage patients died of suicide.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are hired by an anxious groom to look into his bride-to-be on the eve of their wedding; TC makes a touching decision on how to help Cade.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A journalist hires Magnum to track down his anonymous source after they mysteriously go dark; Higgins receives a new assignment from MI-6; Rick's old friend comes to the island, but TC is suspicious of his motives.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: When Rick is asked to assist with a federal investigation of his childhood friend Robbie, Magnum launches his own investigation to see what the federal agents really have on him; Kumu goes under cover in a retirement community.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman uses Nick to get rid of her husband - permanently.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A man blackmails Nick to force him to participate in a casino heist.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Katie, Sylvie's niece, arrives in town. She is suppose to work as a model. Unfortunately a murder interrupts her plans.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman who owns local slums hires Nick to investigate her son's girlfriend. Nick soon questions whether he's working for the right people.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The skeletal remains of a federal prosecutor, who disappeared five years earlier, are discovered in the desert outside Las Vegas; an anonymous lead takes Booth and Brennan to the world of gambling and underground ultimate fighting.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan search for a killer who buries his victims alive and leaves them to die if ransom demands are not met.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate when a headless corpse appears in the woods along with a frightening videotape of events on the night of the murder.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the case of a mutilated body found on the roof of a federal building; Brennan hears from her long-lost father.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When the detectives find a missing 14-year-old working as a prostitute, they set up a sting to put the johns away for statutory rape and find one of her customers is a former professional football player.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives investigate a rape of an actress during a theater production.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When the detectives investigate the sexual assault of the executive of a private military-contract company, they discover a larger conspiracy in Iraq.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: After auditioning for a reality show, a woman is found in Central Park unconscious, with drugs in her system and evidence of sexual assault; Detective Benson and Executive ADA Haden (Harry Connick Jr.) continue to grow closer.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The investigation into a home invasion that ended with two dead leads to a shocking revelation about Detective Rollins.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Executive ADA Haden must cut their romantic weekend short to investigate the disappearance of an underage prostitute, who seems to be one in a series of escorts who went missing after advertising on a newspaper's website.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Olivia's half-brother shows up looking for help when child services threatens to take his kids away; the investigation into an abandoned baby found by a homeless couple leads to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A rape investigation leads to one of Detective Benson's old cases being reopened; as Benson's work is scrutinized, her relationship with Executive ADA David Haden is put in jeopardy.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man sees his wife abducted while video chatting with her, but Benson finds that the victim tried to pick up the ransom herself.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: When a man is shot dead in rural Montana, his ex-wife is accused of murder. She says that she shot him in self-defense after an assault.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: This special 2-hour episode picks up on the powerful and poignant stories of the accused who were featured in season one.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: For 10 years, a murder has been unsolved. Now, police have a suspect. The catch...the accused would have been 13-years-old at the time.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: In February 1971, nearly 30 years before Ivan Milat was convicted and sentenced to life in prison, a young woman was murdered on the outskirts of Canberra, Australia.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets
programme.desc: Forensic anthropologist and criminologist Dr Xanth Mallett and criminal psychologist Tim Watson-Munro have re-opened cold murder cases across New South Wales in Australia to piece together clues that may link the murders to serial killer Ivan Milat.

programme.title: Ivan Milat: Buried Secrets

programme.title: The Family That Slays Together
programme.desc: When Nikki Orvin married Damon Bamberg she had no idea what a twisted family she was now part of.

programme.title: The Family That Slays Together
programme.desc: Alberto Macias loves his wife Laura and his five children and is doing his very best to provide for them during hard times. Then he is found murdered, with two bullet holes in his head.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: In 1989, 21-year-old Lyle and 18-year-old Erik Menendez walked into their parents' den and killed them. In this limited series premiere, Erik Menendez himself shares in stunning detail the events of the week leading up to the murders and the motive behind the crime that shocked America.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: The Trial of the Century takes a shocking turn when the defense says Erik and Lyle Menendez killed their parents after years of sexual abuse.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: Erik Menendez recalls his mother's decline in the years leading up to the murders and looks on in agony as his brother Lyle testifies, vividly describing the abuse at the hands of their father.

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: The first trial ends in a stunning surprise verdict. Erik alone takes us inside the prep for his second trial, his unlikely connection with OJ Simpson, and why he alone is left to speak for both the brothers

programme.title: The Menendez Murders: Erik Tells All
programme.desc: After the verdict comes in, at the last minute, Erik Menendez and his brother, Lyle, are sent to separate prisons. Erik marries and begins to mount an appeal. Will his case be given another chance?

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Hard Knocks in Season: The Indianapolis Colts
programme.desc: The Colts enter a December schedule in which every game is crucial; they travel to Houston to play the Texans; running back Jonathan Taylor resumes his assault on the 2021 rushing title behind one of the best offensive lines led by Quenton Nelson.

programme.title: Hard Knocks in Season: The Indianapolis Colts
programme.desc: The Colts, fresh off their 41-16 victory in Buffalo and with growing MVP buzz about running back Jonathan Taylor, come home for Thanksgiving and face their biggest test yet against Tom Brady and the defending Super Bowl Champion Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Younghoe Koo's 52-yard field goal as time expired in regulation forced overtime, and Cousins took care of the rest as he set a franchise record with 509 passing yards to lift Atlanta (3-2) into a tie atop the division.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Rookie QB Jayden Daniels shined, going 21 of 23 with 254 yards and 3 TDs, leading the Commanders to a 38-33 victory over the Bengals. Joe Burrow's 324 yards weren't enough to avoid Cincinnati's 0-3 start.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Lamar Jackson had 3 fourth-quarter TD passes, and the Ravens stopped the Bengals on a 2-point conversion with 38 seconds remaining to hold them 35-34 on Thursday night. The Ravens rallied from a 21-7 third-quarter deficit.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Eddy Pineiro's 36-yard field goal in overtime secured the Panthers a 20-17 victory over the Giants in Munich, Germany. The Panthers capitalized on a Giants fumble by rookie Tyrone Tracy on the first play of OT, marking their second consecutive win. Chuba Hubbard led Carolina's offense with 153 rushing yards and a touchdown.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Chiefs had took the lead on Butker's field goal with 5:57 remaining, but Bo Nix and the Broncos converted a trio of third downs to march right back down the field. They proceeded to set up Lutz for the game-winning FG, but Chiefs defender Leo Chenal blocked the Broncos' potential winner as time expired to hold on for a 16-14 win to remain perfect.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Marquez Valdes-Scantling caught three passes for 109 yards and two touchdowns in his second game for New Orleans, and the Saints began Rizzi's tenure by snapping a seven-game skid with a 20-17 victory over the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jake Bates nailed a 52-yard field goal as time expired, lifting the Lions to a 26-23 win over the Texans despite Jared Goff's career-high five interceptions. Detroit rallied from a 23-7 halftime deficit, improving to 8-1 for the first time since 1954.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Russell Wilson shook off his first INT in 11 months and hit trade-deadline pickup Mike Williams for a 32-yard touchdown with less than 2:30 left in the fourth quarter for the QB's third scoring throw Sunday, lifting the Pittsburgh Steelers to a 28-27 comeback victory over Jayden Daniels and the Washington Commanders.

Joey and Fury form a special bond and embark upon lifetime adventures at the Broken Wheel Ranch!

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Butch Cassidy is presented as a jovial type against killing as the leader of the Wild Bunch. Matt and Frankie go after the outlaws when bank notes appear with phony signatures.

programme.desc: After a robbery by the Doolin gang, Matt interviews a mortally wounded Ed Brinkley regarding the Doolin hideout in Oklahoma. Frankie shows up pretending to be Ed's widow.

programme.desc: RC Tuttle starts a campaign to encourage residents to move to Benson because of Tombstone's low water supply and inadequate fire fighting equipment, leading a merchant to set fire to his own store to frame Tuttle.

programme.desc: A town full of former outlaws kidnaps Bat and expects him to work as their trusty banker.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates when several shopkeepers along Duquense Street pay twice as much for what their property is worth, & are subsequently robbed & murdered. He learns that a projected railroad spur is to be built to the waterfront through that shopping district and unscrupulous Northerners plan to use illegal means to grab all the available real estate before the project is officially announced.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Derringer is falsely accused of complicity in a waterfront property theft. Administer Colton manages to get Matthew Younger to drop the charges, but Yancy discovers the accuser may be throwing charges around to conceal the real perpetrators. His investigations lead him to a waterfront dive and its grave-robbing habitués.

programme.desc: While hunting a predator wolf, Little Joe finds a gypsy woman who has been rejected from her people because she is believed to be a witch.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When a powerful gang plagues Virginia City with a murderous protection racket, the Cartwrights are determined to stop it even as it threatens them.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: After the bank is robbed of almost all money, Little Joe becomes suspicious of a Ponderosa employee who may be an informant for the bank robbers.

programme.title: Davy Crockett: King of the Wild Frontier
programme.desc: This big-screen movie featuring the coonskin-capped Davy Crockett (Fess Parker) consists of the first three episodes that aired on the Disneyland TV show in 1954. Crockett and his pal George Russel (Buddy Ebsen) battle Native Americans, and Russel gets captured. Crockett does what it takes to save his friend. After the wars, Crockett runs a successful political campaign to become a congressman. But the Texas Revolution calls him back to fight, and he makes his last stand at the Alamo.

programme.title: Davy Crockett and the River Pirates
programme.desc: Davy (Fess Parker) and his partner (Buddy Ebsen) race Mike Fink (Jeff York) down the Mississippi, then fight pirates in disguise.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A former Army scout, current town drunk is down on his luck, so Hoss encourages him to volunteer to lead a troop through a mostly waterless desert.

programme.title: Bonanza

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fiancée Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and décor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off in Lynton, Devon at The Seawood Hotel, managed by couple Martin and Kyle Fletcher, who hope to win over their guests with their high standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gooseford Farm B&B in Dartmoor, Devon, managed by Mary Courtier and husband Julian. The farmhouse impresses but Jean and Dec are left counting the cost.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to Trevarrian Lodge in Newquay Cornwall, where Jean and her pro-chef husband, Dec Hegarty are hoping the food will win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Rivendell Outdoor Club, a clothing-optional resort in Wimborne, Dorset, managed by Kerry Murphy and Andy Gautry. However, not everyone is keen to let it all hang out.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition starts in Barmouth, north Wales, at the Bae Abermaw Hotel, run by newly engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green. On arrival, guest Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Rigsby's Guest House in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, run by Tracy Ward. The lack of en-suite bathrooms causes a stink, and some guests cannot figure out the pricing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where John Adams is joined by friend Dennis Gowie. But cleanliness issues and thin walls gave cause for concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Cross Keys Hotel, Saffron Walden, Essex run by former flight attendant Nici Van Valen. The guests love the luxury but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and tensions are at boiling point.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: First up, Jon and Lisa welcome their rivals to the Swan Motel in Norfolk, but some of their guests find a surprise in their drawers. Later, Jon shows off his magical hosting skills on a boat tour.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michael and Scott welcome their rivals to the Hare and Hounds in Essex. They take their guests clay pigeon shooting, but Jon and Lisa find it hard to forget the feedback that their hosts gave them the day before.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sir Ben Slade welcomes his rivals to the 13th-century Maunsel House in Somerset, but the extra charge for a hot breakfast leaves some guests with a bad taste in their mouths. Meanwhile, Jon and Lisa turn detective to uncover Ben's past.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gary and Linda Kellaway welcome their rivals to Lower Keats Glamping in Devon. At dinner, Jon turns joker, but Michael and Scott have a big revelation, which is no laughing matter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four more sets of bed and breakfast owners compete, kicking off in Tyne and Wear at Tynemouth 61, owned by hospitality veteran Stephen Minns, who grew up believing he was born with blue blood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional décor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Railway Inn near Hull, run by couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize. The guests find little to complain about, but the pressure is on for Luke's breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Driftwood bed and breakfast in Weymouth, run by Sarah and Pete Healey. On arrival Cathy and Genice find the place completely ship shape and Lygia spies the host's disco balls.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman and breakfast chef Mary Murray pride themselves on a luxury stay, but emotions run high.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Nottinghamshire at The Clumber Park Hotel, where general Manager Rajesh Saraf and his colleague Yuanee Tampoe believe all guests should be treated as gods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Family Tree in Derbyshire, where owners Charlie and Sam Cameron want their guests to feel like one of the family. However, some of them are creeped out by the rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to The Royal Hotel in Sheerness, Kent, where partners Sarah Lewry and Gareth Segrove believe they offer great value for money, but the guests have a lot to say.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to Adhurst Yurts in Hampshire, where owner Alison Lubbock is on a mission to educate her guests to think green, but they question the provenance of her produce.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp and daughter Galatea who hope their peaceful woodland cabins will win over the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends Bed and Breakfast in Blackpool, Lancashire run by Luke and John Conway, who are the self-proclaimed unique selling point. But feedback from some leaves a bitter taste.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, which owner Debbie Grant has built from the ground up over the past twenty years. However, some of the guests think the décor is too dated.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, owned by Mark Hinchcliffe and Heidi Donohoe, who pride themselves on offering something special in their converted chapel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Heather and Sally hope their fussy cleaning regime will impress their rivals at Brockley Hall Hotel in Yorkshire. But there are problems in some rooms, and the breakfast puzzles the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair, who has fitted out luxury hotels including The Savoy, welcomes his rivals to his refurbished village pub, The Star Inn 1744, where his breakfast ordering system raises questions.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michelle and Jason welcome their rivals to their luxury lodges at Croft Farm Park in Gloucestershire. The guests go canoeing but some struggle to stay afloat when someone sticks his oar in.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Tracy welcome their rivals to their bed and breakfast Harbour Vista in Poole, and most of their guests are surprised that it's not more lavish, when they realise they are staying in Steve's house.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Grosmont, North Yorkshire, at Grosmont House B&B, mother and daughter Selma and Roxy hope their personal touch and attention to detail will win over their competitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Monkspool bed and breakdast in Twyning, Gloucestershire. The establishment is owned by husband and wife Paulo and Suzi Lacey, who pride themselves on their top-quality mattresses.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Pymgate Lodge Hotel in Cheadle, where Romanian husband and wife Michael and Leda Ardeleanu believe their hosting skills will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to pub, restaurant and bed and breakfast The Stag and Huntsman in Hambleden, Oxfordshire, managed by South African chef Marius Pretorius and his partner Sarah Harris.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the décor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top Six junior home cooks tackle the most daunting challenge in MASTERCHEF JUNIOR history when they take over Michelin Star Los Angeles restaurant Mélisse. To rise to the occasion, the teams face an intense environment, hungry guests with high expectations and the wrath of Gordon Ramsay. Find out which team makes it straight into the semifinal and which team will be sent into eliminations.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the season’s last mystery box challenge, the remaining contestants receive a surprise taste from home when they are tasked with creating a dish inspired by family. Whoever wins this challenge will immediately earn a spot in the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR finale. Then, in a juicy elimination test, the chef-testant who elevates a secret ingredient with the most finesse and personality will secure his or her spot in the finale. See how far the junior home cooks have come.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay helps professional belly dancer-turned-restaurant owner Rishi with her eatery. With little kitchen experience, Rishi lets the head chef control kitchen operations.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: The owners of Chappyês, a Cajun-style restaurant, had to move in the wake of Hurricane Katrina. Now in Nashville, theyêre struggling to find a loyal base of customers.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining chefs must cook with exotic proteins, including ostrich and wild boar, to impress Chef Ramsay and the owners of the restaurant Animal.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs cook a Mardi Gras-themed homecoming dinner for Calabasas High School. Both teams have 35 minutes to create three meals for the homecoming committee.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Auditions continue.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The judges give out the final white aprons.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: A battle of the culinary world’s next generation comes to a head in this exciting two-hour finale showdown. The season began with 24 contestants, but now only three young chef-testants remain standing. The challenges this year were more intense, and more inspiring, than ever before. It’s a fight to the finish and only one will take it all home – the trophy, the coveted title of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR and the $100,000 grand prize. Watch as the home cooks dish up the best three-course meal of their lives, proving they have what it takes to win.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S01:E04 - Episode 4

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S01:E06 - Episode 6

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and rabbit, rose veal and venison are all dished up for `Great British Menu' veteran Richard Corrigan. Plus, one of the chefs is joined by `Eastenders' star June Brown for a fundraising challenge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course. Will a strawberry and coconut dessert, a frozen white chocolate dish or apple and cherries come out on top? `Great British Menu' veteran judge Richard Corrigan will decide who goes through to the judges tomorrow.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from London and the South East. One chef left the competition last time and only two remain. They will cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. This time they will be joined by celebrity guest judge, comedienne and writer Arabella Weir.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is finals week and 24 of the nation's finest chefs have been whittled down to just eight. Over the course of four hour-long shows, they will battle it out in the kitchen for the chance to get a dish to the Comic Relief Banquet. Actress Patricia Hodge, one of the stars of sitcom `Miranda', joins judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort to taste all eight winning regional starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish courses. They are all vying to finish in the top three and still be in with a chance of cooking at the special banquet. Tensions are high but there are still plenty of laughs as new dishes are introduced under competition rules, including a Sicilian influenced dish called the `Cod Father'. Impressionist Ronni Ancona joins the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Comedian Ade Edmondson tucks into the chefs' main courses to help decide which three will remain in contention to cook at the special banquet. However, the chefs are in for a major surprise as the judges deliver unexpected news about the day's competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judgement day as the chefs not only learn the top three desserts but the judges announce the winning menu. `Fast Show' writer and performer Charlie Higson helps judge the puddings. Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort decide on the four winning dishes, but there is a problem - they are torn between two dishes for one of the courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the climax of the competition as the winning chefs cook at the Comic Relief Banquet at the Royal Albert Hall. Special guest and co-founder of the charity Richard Curtis welcomes guests - the unsung heroes of charity work, as well as those who have benefited from their help and some of the celebrities who have inspired us to do something funny for money.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer'. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybody's favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and, with a seafood specialist in the kitchen, the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs compete for a place in the national finals. To get there they'll have to impress the formidable panel of judges: Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and the pressure is intense in the kitchen. In the hope of impressing the veteran judge, Paul Askew is serving an extremely personal main course based on his mother's favourite food.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Paul can't afford to make any mistakes and is pushing himself with a technically challenging baked alaska.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining north west chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. The guest judge is Greg Rusedski, former British number one, who understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning banquet champion Tommy Banks takes on two ambitious newcomers, Danny Parker and Josh Overington. They start by finding out whois the surprise veteran judge and who will be marking their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated, the three chefs are cooking their fish courses. Josh Overington creates a decadent dish inspired by the prestige of the Wimbledon Championships.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protégé of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiancé, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision, gained from working at two-Michelin-starred restaurant `Andrew Fairlie'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross seeks victory with his dish `Lobster Aid'. Lorna's `Live Well, Live Very Well' features only three elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is hoping to impress with `Oh Deer It's Time For Your Penicillin', his tribute to Scottish scientist Alexander Fleming featuring an unusual yeast element as well as venison. Across the kitchen, Lorna, a former Game Chef of the Year, is also cooking venison in a bid to impress.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is attempting to elevate a classic into a dish worthy of the banquet, Lorna is cooking a personal tribute to NHS staff using unusual yuzu and tonka bean flavours, and Ben is serving an experimental dish which includes a bees wax ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judging day and the two remaining chefs must impress the panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort. Both chefs are gunning for success and are doing everything they can to deliver their menus to perfection.

programme.title: saltwater experience
